info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:29PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL PECOS AND SOUTH CENTRAL REEVES COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM CDT... At 329 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Saragosa, or 26 miles southeast of Toyah, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Balmorhea, Balmorhea Lake, Saragosa, and Verhalen. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 206 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
